metadata.title: CVE-2019-9797 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-origin images can be read in violation of the same-origin policy byexporting an image after using createImageBitmap to read the image and thenrendering the resulting bitmap image within a canvas element. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
